IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To provide financial grants to nonprofit summer camps for use in providing children from low income families with access to the benefits of personal development experiences of summer camp.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide financial grants to nonprofit summer camps for use in providing children from low income families with access to the benefits of personal development experiences of summer camp.
IRS990.Desc: NUMEROUS GRANTS WERE PROVIDED TO NON-PROFIT RESIDENT SUMMER CAMPS TO COVER THE SESSION COST FOR 670 CAMP SCHOLARSHIPS FOR CHILDREN FROM LOW-INCOME FAMILIES TO ATTEND THEIR FACILITIES DURING THE SUMMER TO FURTHER A COMMON OBJECTIVE TO KEEP CHILDREN SAFELY STIMULATED THROUGH ENRICHING CAMP EXPERIENCES AND ENCOURAGING POSITIVE BEHAVIORS DURING THEIR SUMMER SCHOOL BREAK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COSTS OF BENEFIT TO DONORS INCLUDED $114964

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SPECIAL EVENT COSTS OF BENEFIT TO DONORS $114964

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANTEE ORGANIZATION MUST SHOW PROOF OF THE FOLLOWING:1) PROOF OF 501 C 3 STATUS2) PROOF OF CAMPER FINANCIAL HARDSHIP3) PROOF OF CAMPER ATTENDANCE

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Neil Canell and Jay Canell are brothers and business associates.Andy Siegel, Justin Mayer, and Jay Jacobs are all business associates.Jill Kleinman and Mark Transport are business associates.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is reviewed by governing body before filing. Any proposed changes and or issues are discussed and approved before filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each board member shall annually complete a disclosure form identifying any relationships, positions, or circumstatnces in which he/she is involved that he or she believes could contribute to a conflict of interest arising.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION REVIEW & APPROVAL OF EXECUTIVE STAFF IS DONE BY A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF FORMER BOARD PRESIDENTS (STIL ON SCOPE BOARD OF DIRECTORS), CURRENT BOARD PRESIDENT AND MEMBERS OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents and policies are available upon request. Form 990 and Financial Statements are available on upon request and available on various public non profit websites such as Guidestar.
